title: Human Resource Manager Job at Tailored Talent
content:
Tailored Talent - Our client, a fast-growing fintech company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are a fast-growing fintech company redefining financial services through innovation, technology, and customer-centric solutions.
	As we continue to scale, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Human Resources Manager to lead our people strategy and foster a high-performance, inclusive, and agile work environment.
	The ideal candidate will have previous experience in a technology-driven organization, preferably within fintech, and a proven ability to support fast-paced, high-growth teams.


Key Responsibilities
HR Strategy & Operations:


	Design and implement HR strategies aligned with overall business goals.
	Lead and manage end-to-end HR functions including recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee relations, compensation, and benefits.
	Develop and maintain HR policies, procedures, and compliance frameworks tailored for a tech-driven environment.


Talent Acquisition & Management:


	Partner with department heads to identify staffing needs and attract top tech talent.
	Drive a seamless and engaging recruitment process, leveraging tech platforms and data-driven sourcing strategies.
	Oversee employee lifecycle activities — from hiring to offboarding.


Culture & Development:


	Champion company culture, values, and engagement initiatives.
	Lead training and development programs that support technical and soft skill growth.
	Implement employee feedback and pulse surveys to enhance workplace satisfaction.


Performance & Analytics:


	Develop and track KPIs related to hiring, retention, and performance.
	Provide strategic insights to leadership using HR analytics and dashboards.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with labor laws, data protection regulations, and HR best practices.
	Manage workplace investigations and resolve conflicts with fairness and discretion.


Preferred Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. (MBA or CIPM/SHRM is a plus)
	3+ years of HR experience in a technology or fintech company.
	Proven experience working in a fast-paced, scaling startup or tech-driven environment.
	Deep understanding of tech talent dynamics and culture.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Hands-on experience with modern HR tools (e.g., BambooHR, Deel, Notion, Lever, etc.).


What We Offer


	A chance to work at the intersection of finance and innovation.
	High-impact role with room for growth and leadership.
	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Collaborative and flexible work environment.

title: Sales Officer Job at Lopterra Services Limited
content:
Lopterra Services Limited - Our client stands out as one of the most competitive renewable energy and power systems firms in Nigeria. By working with this esteemed organisation, you will encounter a diverse range of learning experiences and challenges that will foster your professional development. and becoming part of a passionate community of professionals dedicated to transforming the way the world is powered.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Functionally Reports To: Business Development Manager, Lagos State

Job Objective/Purpose of Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The primary objective is to generate revenue by identifying and securing new customers, maintaining relationships with existing clients and promoting the company's products and services.
	The Sales Officer will be responsible for achieving sales targets, conducting market research, following up on leads and providing excellent customer service to drive business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Target both business clients (C&I) and individual customers (B2C) with our solar power solutions Inverters and UPS systems
	Actively prospect for new customers by cold calling, networking and following up on leads to create opportunities.
	Own the full sales cycle from lead generation to closing, ensuring customer satisfaction at every stage.
	Develop and deliver compelling and tailored sales presentations, proposals and pitches to key stakeholders (businesses and individual clients).
	Deliver measurable results by consistently hitting and surpassing monthly sales targets.
	Develop and maintain long-term relationships with both business and individual clients to drive repeat business and referrals.
	Provide regular updates and reports to supervisor on business development activities, progress, and outcomes.
	Stay on top of industry trends and competitive offerings to fine-tune your sales strategy and remain ahead of the game.


Requirements


	Educational Qualification: A minimum of OND in Marketing, Mathematics, Business Administration, or related field. • Professional Qualification: Added Advantage.
	Minimum of two (2) years in direct sales, with experience in both B2B and B2C environments (preferably in the renewable energy and technology, or similar industry).
	Sales-Focused Mindset: You are not just looking to meet targets—you want to exceed them. You are passionate about winning and making sales happen.
	Strong Communication Skills: You can effectively pitch to a wide range of clients, from large businesses to individual consumers.
	Self-Starter: You take ownership of your sales territory, work independently and don’t need micromanaging to succeed.
	Passion for Renewable Energy: A genuine interest in solar power, sustainable energy, or technology.
	Flexible & Adaptable: Whether you are meeting a business executive or an individual homeowner, you can adapt your approach to different client types.
	Travel Willingness: Field-based role requiring travel across assigned regions.
	Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office suites

title: Field Fiber Engineer Job at Tizeti Network Limited
content:
Tizeti Network Limited (wifi.com.ng) is a fast growing NCC licensed internet service provider and top provider of Unlimited internet in Nigeria as well as West Africa Countries. Our services are reliable, affordable and available in various packages to suit the needs of our customers. We also provide excellent customer support to ensure that our clients have a seamless internet experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Fiber Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Field Fiber Engineer is responsible for the on-site deployment, installation, maintenance, and repair of fiber optic infrastructure.
	This role involves working directly in the field to ensure high-quality service delivery, supporting fiber rollouts, customer activations, and resolving technical faults.
	The ideal candidate is hands-on, technically skilled, and committed to delivering reliable connectivity to end users.


Responsibilities


	Execute field installations of fiber optic cables for FTTH, FTTB, or backbone networks.
	Perform splicing, termination, and testing of fiber using tools like OTDR, power meters, and splicing machines.
	Conduct site surveys for new deployments and prepare technical site reports.
	Ensure clean, secure routing and termination of fiber cables.
	Work closely with the NOC and support teams to provide field updates and resolve escalated issues.
	Install and configure customer-premise equipment (CPE), including ONUs and routers.
	Troubleshoot and resolve connectivity issues for residential and business fiber customers.
	Adhere to safety standards and ensure compliance with installation protocols.
	Maintain accurate documentation of all fiber activities and site visits.
	Educate and guide customers on basic usage and care of installed equipment.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND, B.Eng with experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: HR@Tizeti.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Cashier / Inventory Officer Job at Salpha Energy Limited
content:
Salpha Energy is a leading renewable energy company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing reliable and sustainable solar power solutions to residential, commercial, and industrial clients. Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of clean energy across Nigeria, reducing carbon footprints and empowering communities with affordable and consistent power. We are a passionate team driven by innovation, customer satisfaction, and a commitment to a greener future for our nation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier / Inventory Officer
Job Location: Ojo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As the Cashier / Inventory Officer, you will work closely with the location’s sales officers to facilitate customer purchasing, as well as handling and ensuring payments by the customer.
	You are saddled with the responsibility of handling stocks and inventory in the location of your operation by ensuring proper handling, receiving and documentation of the inventory received.
	You will be responsible for processing and receiving payments, issuing receipt and ensure proper documentation in the drive.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Transactions:


	Assist to achieve branch budgeted sales and profit target.
	Collecting payments for products either in cash or credit.
	Accepting payments, ensuring all prices and quantities are accurate and providing receipt for every sales transaction.
	Ensure products presented by customers are properly handled to the satisfaction of the customer.
	Cross checking items presented for purchase by customers to see that they are in good condition.
	Track sales transactions and report any discrepancies to the management.
	Resolving customers’ complaints. Inventory Management:
	Receive and handling of the location’s inventories/Stock.


Inventory Management:


	Ensure accountability and safety of the location’s inventory.
	Ensure stock release only on approval of the Sales Order Form.
	Ensure regular stock count at least twice in a month.
	Have proper knowledge of all companies’ products and prices.
	Escalate issues relating to inconsistencies in inventory to the financial accountant.


Cash Management:


	Make deposit of cash received to the bank.
	Daily reconciliations of cash and bank.
	Regular checks/phone calls to customers indebted to the company.


Record Keeping:


	Balancing the cash register and generating reports for credit and debit sales.
	Maintain accurate record of inventory sent to the station.
	Documenting sales, payments, and credits sales on the drive.
	Ensuring proper documentation of stocks and inventory issued out for sales.
	Keep proper record of cash and expenses within the location. Station Management:
	Maintain clean and tidy warehouse/storeroom and other equipment.
	Perform any other duties that may be assigned.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting / Business Administration / Economics or any relevant field with 3 - 5 years of experience
	Computer Savvy
	Excellent knowledge of Google Suites
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
	Proven experience as a cashier is an added advantage.
	Candidates must reside in the job location.


Key Qualities Expected:
Appearance and Dressing:


	The Cashier/Inventory Officer will be clean and neatly attired while on duty in a manner befitting of your position.
	Teamwork – Ability to work within a diverse team with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	An eye for details.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multi-task effectively.
	Candidates living around Ojo, Mile2, Festac, Satelite are advised to apply.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.
